subtitleNullable: Exploring the impact of social media on mental health in Central Asia
descriptionNullable: The dataset comprises comprehensive information on the relationship between social media usage and mental health across different demographics in Central Asian countries. The data covers a variety of factors, including country, age group, gender, urban or rural residence, daily social media usage, most used social media platforms, and the frequency of social media use. Additionally, it includes metrics on social media engagement such as likes, comments, and shares per post. Mental health indicators like social anxiety levels, body image impact, sleep quality impact, self-confidence impact, and anxiety levels are also documented. The dataset further accounts for socioeconomic status, education level, state, and experiences with cyberbullying, providing a holistic view of the impact of social media on mental health.
title: Social_Media_Central_Asia_MentalHealth
